Create a new consulting project

Source: R/project_registry.R
create_project.Rd

Creates a new consulting project by:

  • prompting the user to select the project folder (relative to the SCC Box root),

  • generating a project ID of the form term_department_contact,

  • writing a canonical JSON project record to the project registry.

Usage

create_project(
  project_name,
  term = NULL,
  start_date = NULL,
  category = NA,
  contact,
  department,
  organization = NA,
  status = "intake",
  consultants = Sys.info()[["user"]],
  notes = NA
)

Arguments

project_name

Project name (title).

term

Academic term label (e.g., "2026SP"). If NULL, the term is inferred from the system date.

start_date

Optional project start date. Defaults to Sys.Date().

category

Optional category label (e.g., "Education").

contact

Primary contact name or email. Used to form the project ID.

department

Department name. Used to form the project ID.

organization

Optional organization name.

status

Initial project status. Defaults to "intake".

consultants

Character vector of consultant names. Defaults to the current system user.

notes

String of any additional notes about the project.

Value

Invisibly returns a named list containing:

  • project_id

  • project_path (relative to the Box root)

  • registry_file (full path to the JSON file)

Details

The project registry is stored at <Box Root>/project_registry/, with one JSON file per project named <project_id>.json.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
create_project(
  project_name = "Student retention analysis",
  consultants = c("Jane Doe", "A. Smith"),
  category = "Education",
  department = "Student Success",
  contact = "jdoe@example.edu",
  organization = "Example University"
)
} # }
